privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: RevenueX ("the Service") is a revenue simulation tool for indie developers. This policy explains how we handle data in the Service.
privacy.section1Content: The Service does not require account registration and does not collect personal information. All simulation data you enter (expenses, income, period settings, etc.) is stored exclusively in your browser's LocalStorage and is never transmitted to external servers.
privacy.section2Content: The Service may use cookies or LocalStorage to persist your theme preference (dark/light mode) and language setting. We do not use tracking cookies.
privacy.section3Content: The Service may use analytics tools to improve the service. These tools may collect anonymized usage statistics but do not collect personally identifiable information.
privacy.section4Content: All simulation data is stored solely in your browser's LocalStorage. Clearing your browser data will also delete any saved simulation configurations.
privacy.section5Content: The Service does not share or sell user data to third parties.
privacy.section6Content: If you have questions about this policy, please reach out via our contact form.
privacy.section7Content: This policy may be updated without prior notice. Significant changes will be communicated on this page.

help.title: Help
help.subtitle: Getting Started Guide
help.intro: RevenueX is a revenue simulator for indie developers. Enter your expenses, income, and growth rate to visualize monthly cash flow in real time.
help.section1Content: Enter your expenses, income, and period settings in the left column. The chart and KPI metrics on the right update in real time. Your data is automatically saved to your browser.
help.section2Content: Configure initial costs (one-time expenses like equipment), fixed costs (recurring monthly costs like server fees), variable costs (per-user costs like API usage), and transaction fees (store or payment processor rates).
help.section3Content: Combine subscriptions (with conversion and churn rates), advertising revenue (monthly income per user), and one-time purchases (purchase rate among new users).
help.section4Content: The main chart shows trends for income, expenses, cumulative profit, and user count. The yellow dashed line marks the break-even point (BEP) — the month when cumulative losses are eliminated.
help.section5Content: Three key metrics are displayed: break-even month (when cumulative profit turns positive), max deficit (maximum capital required), and final month profit. Use these as rough estimates for your business planning.
